title: KIM SWITCH / RACIST KITSURAGI
description: Dialogue about if you are down the racism. Triggers some distance after leaving the lorry driver (it's hooked up to the Kim switchboard).

dialogueTree.title: Suggestion: "Well, now you've done it. Let's see..."
dialogueTree.text: Well, now you've done it. Let's see if you can talk your way out of this one.

links.title: You: ""Relax, I was practising the time-h..."
links.text: "Relax, I was practising the time-honoured technique known as the 'lie'."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I suppose that's a relief. Just be..."
links.text: "I suppose that's a relief. Just be careful how often you avail yourself of this 'technique'. A lie may be useful in the short-term, but they have a way of catching up with you later."

links.title: Drama: "We know a *lie*, sire. And it didn'..."
links.text: We know a *lie*, sire. And it didn't feel like one to us. He chooses to believe though -- for now.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""And one more thing -- as you've se..."
links.text: "And one more thing -- as you've seen, these sorts of attitudes are quite common in Martinaise. So I expect this to happen again. And again..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I've had this conversation enough..."
links.text: "I've had this conversation enough times in my life. From now on, I'm  going to stay out of it. How you choose to respond is your business." He concludes: "But be careful. Now, let's move on."

links.title: You: ""I was just trying to convey that I..."
links.text: "I was just trying to convey that I understood his grievances and wasn't judging him for having them."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant narrows his gaze. "S..."
links.text: The lieutenant narrows his gaze. "So you *don't* find his views... say, *unbefitting of a police officer*?"

links.title: Rhetoric: "Okay... feels like this is going to..."
links.text: Okay... feels like this is going to be a *discussion* now.

links.title: You: ""It's not about me. As police offic..."
links.text: "It's not about me. As police officers, we gain nothing by staking out the moral high ground over him."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Our position in Revachol is alread..."
links.text: "Our position in Revachol is already precarious: Many people think we're vigilantes as it is. I can't have them thinking we're *racist* vigilantes to boot."

links.title: You: ""You're right. I didn't mean to cau..."
links.text: "You're right. I didn't mean to cause trouble. Sorry about that."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Apology accepted, detective." The..."
links.text: "Apology accepted, detective." The lieutenant relaxes. A weight seems to have been lifted from his shoulders.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""That's good to hear. I don't want..."
links.text: "That's good to hear. I don't want there to be any unnecessary friction in our relationship during this *important* case."

links.title: You: ""Well, *actually*...""
links.text: "Well, *actually*..."

links.title: Rhetoric: "Wait a second. Are you sure you wan..."
links.text: Wait a second. Are you sure you want to go there? Even if you succeed, you're going to fail.

links.title: You: "What do you mean? I'm in the right..."
links.text: What do you mean? I'm in the right here.

links.title: Rhetoric: "Are you sure about that?"
links.text: Are you sure about that?

links.title: You: "Yes."
links.text: Yes.

links.title: Rhetoric: "Hoo boy, we're really doing this."
links.text: Hoo boy, we're really doing this.

links.title: You: ""Everyone thinks they're better tha..."
links.text: "Everyone thinks they're better than other people. Some people are just particularly crude about it."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""There's a difference between sayin..."
links.text: "There's a difference between saying something crude -- and an ideological racist."

links.title: Rhetoric: "Okay. You think there's a way out o..."
links.text: Okay. You think there's a way out of this.

links.title: You: ""That doesn't mean they don't have..."
links.text: "That doesn't mean they don't have rights. If they're perpetrators, then we punish, if they're victims, then we help. That's all there is."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant falls silent and loo..."
links.text: The lieutenant falls silent and looks down at his boots. Whether he thinks you have a point or not, he isn't saying. It's unclear what this means for your relationship. Then he speaks...

links.title: You: ""It's basic biology.""
links.text: "It's basic biology."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant says nothing, waitin..."
links.text: The lieutenant says nothing, waiting for you to continue.

links.title: You: ""It's only rational for a society t..."
links.text: "It's only rational for a society to select for the most desirable traits. That's how it works in Nature."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""And what exactly do you think shou..."
links.text: "And what exactly do you think should happen to those with *undesirable* traits?"

links.title: You: "(Shrug.) "Let Nature sort them out...."
links.text: (Shrug.) "Let Nature sort them out."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Well," he says after taking a mome..."
links.text: "Well," he says after taking a moment to collect himself. "You've made your views on the subject quite clear..." Another little pause.

links.title: You: ""I've got nothing against them, but..."
links.text: "I've got nothing against them, but we have a responsibility to future generations."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Wonderful." The lieutenant falls s..."
links.text: "Wonderful." The lieutenant falls silent. His expression is hard to read, but it certainly doesn't look *happy*. Then he speaks...

links.title: You: ""Wait, am I becoming some sort of D..."
links.text: "Wait, am I becoming some sort of Death's Head Racist suddenly?!"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I don't know what you mean by *dea..."
links.text: "I don't know what you mean by *death's head* but it certainly looks like you're becoming a racist, officer."

links.title: Rhetoric: "Here we go. Zoom in on the mixed ra..."
links.text: Here we go. Zoom in on the mixed races part. It's the best one.

links.title: You: ""Look, what happens when the races..."
links.text: "Look, what happens when the races get all mixed up?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I'm going to *stop* this conversat..."
links.text: "I'm going to *stop* this conversation." He makes a sudden hand gesture. An open palm. "This is Martinaise. People have certain attitudes here. You will find plenty of citizens to agree with you. As for me..."

links.title: You: "Forget it, this was a dumb idea."
links.text: Forget it, this was a dumb idea.

links.title: You: "On second thought, maybe I don't."
links.text: On second thought, maybe I don't.

links.title: Rhetoric: "Now you're thinking sensibly."
links.text: Now you're thinking sensibly.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Stop right there. I know what you'..."
links.text: "Stop right there. I know what you're going to say. Don't. Also -- these attitudes are quite common in Martinaise. So I expect this to happen again. And again."

links.title: You: ""Of course. But he's also not entir..."
links.text: "Of course. But he's also not entirely responsible for them. I haven't been in this world for long -- already I'm a product of my environment."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""There are tens of thousands of peo..."
links.text: "There are tens of thousands of people who grew up in Martinaise and somehow managed to avoid becoming racists who yell 'Come here, saffron picker' at passers by."

links.title: You: ""Maybe he's got a point.""
links.text: "Maybe he's got a point."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""And what point would that be?""
links.text: "And what point would that be?"

links.title: You: ""I don't really want to talk about..."
links.text: "I don't really want to talk about it." [Leave.]

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant looks at you in sile..."
links.text: The lieutenant looks at you in silence, though you cannot discern if he's judging you or not. "I suppose your reasons are your own."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Let me say just one more thing. As..."
links.text: "Let me say just one more thing. As you've seen, these sorts of attitudes are quite common in Martinaise. So I expect this to happen again. And again..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I've had this conversation enough..."
links.text: "I've had this conversation enough times in my life. From now on, I'm going to stay out of it. How you choose to respond is your business." He concludes: "Now -- let's get back to the task at hand."
